meanings.definition: Of or relating to a signature or handwriting.
meanings.sent1: The artist's autographic style was easily recognizable by the unique way he signed his name.
meanings.sent2: The autographic nature of the document confirmed its authenticity.
meanings.sent3: The autographic signature on the painting was so messy that it looked like a scribble!
meanings.sent4: Her autographic handwriting danced across the page like a graceful swan.
meanings.sent5: The autographic mark left by the pen was bold and striking.

meanings.sent1: She kept an autographic journal to record her thoughts and experiences.
meanings.sent2: The autobiography was an autographic masterpiece, capturing the author's life in vivid detail.
meanings.sent3: Reading his autographic diary felt like peeking into someone's personal world.
meanings.sent4: Her words painted an autographic picture of her journey through life.
meanings.sent5: The autographic account was filled with raw emotions and honest reflections.

meanings.definition: A method of reproducing an image or text by hand.
meanings.sent1: Before the invention of the printing press, books were produced through the autographic process.
meanings.sent2: The artist chose to create an autographic copy of the painting instead of using a machine.
meanings.sent3: The autographic technique required precision and skill to replicate the original work.
meanings.sent4: She learned the autographic method of calligraphy to create beautiful handwritten invitations.
meanings.sent5: The autographic reproduction captured every detail of the original artwork.
